name: Kashi
title: Kashi - Traveling China like your home yard
overview: Kashi (Kashgar) is an ancient city in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, located on the historic Silk Road. Known for its vibrant bazaars, traditional Uyghur culture, and stunning desert landscapes, Kashi offers a unique blend of Central Asian and Chinese influences.

highlights.attractions: Id Kah Mosque, Kashgar Old Town, Sunday Bazaar, Abakh Khoja Tomb
highlights.cuisine: Uyghur Polo, Kebabs, Naan Bread, Hand-pulled Noodles, Dried Fruits
highlights.bestTime: Spring (April-May) and Autumn (September-October) with mild weather

dishes.name: Uyghur Polo
dishes.description: Traditional Uyghur rice pilaf with lamb, carrots, and aromatic spices.

dishes.name: Lamb Kebabs
dishes.description: Tender lamb skewers grilled over charcoal with cumin and spices.

dishes.name: Uyghur Naan
dishes.description: Traditional flatbread baked in clay ovens, perfect with kebabs.

foodStreets.name: Kashgar Night Market
foodStreets.description: Vibrant night market with Uyghur specialties and street food.

foodStreets.name: Old Town Food Area
foodStreets.description: Traditional Uyghur restaurants in the historic old town.

By Bus: Long-distance bus services from neighboring regions
gettingAround: Taxi: Available for convenient travel within the city
